review_text: I had the pleasure of trying Prince Street Pizza in NYC, and it's genuinely delightful! The slices are priced fairly, offering an authentic New York pizza experience. However, a word of caution: seating is limited, so be prepared for the possibility of not finding a spot to sit down. Keep that in mind, and you won't be disappointed. A must-visit for pizza aficionados!

Must try Detroit style square pie in NYC! The portions are huge for a great price, and the curly pepperonis are deliciously oily and authentic. There will definitely be a line, so expect to wait at least 15 minutes, but once you order, you'll get the pizza immediately. There isn't really anywhere to eat inside or outside, so you kind of have to eat while walking around or on a street corner. Amazing for takeout/delivery too! One slice will be enough to fill you, but two is good if you want to be stuffed

Ordered the Fancy Prince - aka Margarita pizza pie. Overall it was a nice thin crust with sufficient fresh mozzarella and slightly sweet marinara sauce. I really wish they had more places to sit down and eat it but we managed by snagging a table right outside the place. We called ahead to order our pie and it was ready for pick up as promised. They have 2 sections- one to pick up pies and the other side for individual slices. their lines move quick but you may not have a place right outside to eat it while it's hot.
So damn good. Oily but very flavorful. Feels like classic NYC pizza but the top of the barrel.

The pizza was okay  if you like a thicker slice more on the doughy side this is for you. I prefer crispy pizzas. The reason for the stars was the flavors weren't really there I thought it was just okay I was expecting a lot more for the price. If you're looking for the best flavor pizza I'd go elsewhere. The pizza was on average fine - i tried the  pepperoni , vodka pizza it was okay l the meat lovers out of all 3 I would say this one was best  the sausage slices added some flavor.

Prices for slices are not clear make sure to ask up front.  For 3 slices and one peroni beer it all came out  to be $30. I found it to be overpriced.

Got the pepperoni slice! The pepperonis were spicy, the sauce was sweet. This was a heavy slice with a thick crust. Slice could've been heated a bit longer for more crunchiness and heat.

Service was friendly and fast.

At the time of this review the pepperoni slice was $7.08 with taxes.

Walked in on off hours and was happy to see that the line wasn't wrapped around the block like it usually is. We had to wait maybe 10-15 minutes on line but the line did go fast. We got the pepperoni and Margherrita slices. Each slide was a bit pricey but they definitely did not skimp out on the pepperoni portions so you do get your money's worth. I enjoyed the Margherrita slice a lot more as I am more of a thin crust girl but the pepperoni slice had a nice chewy texture to it. I'd say if you don't have to wait too long on line, it is definitely worth giving a try.

It's worth trying. We came on a weekend as we were in New York for a couple of days. Yes the reviews are accurate...the line is long. Several people gave up and walked off as the line really didn't move much. Once we got to the counter, they announced "cash only." Good thing we had cash, but I felt for those who didn't and had been waiting for so long already. We got a slice of the spicy vodka and a whole box of pepperoni. This was way too much for 2 people haha, but we figured we could eat on it later for dinner. Our total was pricey. My recommendation for two people? 4-5 slices is PLENTY. You may not even finish it all. I wish I would've known this. There are only a couple of tables outside to sit and a little standing room in the restaurant.
As for the pizza itself? It was delicious. Especially the vodka flavor. Personal opinion? This pizza is not good cold. We didn't have a microwave and let me tell you...you need one for these leftovers. Again, worth trying. Just know what you're getting yourself into.

This place is absolutely amazing. I don't care what anyone else says; I first tried it two years ago, and upon returning for another taste, it still blew me away. The flavors were divine, and the sauce was just perfect in my opinion--striking the right balance with a pleasant acidity, not overly sweet. The pizza had a crispy crust with a delightful chewiness to it. The pepperoni was classic, offering that signature greasiness but perfectly crispy and not overly salty.

I made it a point to visit twice this year before leaving, even though the lines were quite long. However, the staff proved to be incredibly efficient and speedy in serving customers. On my second visit during the week, there were no lines to contend with, and the pizza was just as fantastic and fresh. Enjoying the meal inside the establishment was a treat, and the people were friendly, making the experience all the more enjoyable.

Really great pizza but maybe a tiny bit overhyped? Don't get me wrong - their classic pepperoni pizza is delicious and lives up to his name. But I wouldn't go as far as others in saying this is the best pizza in NYC. This pizza is well received by pizza fanatics who prefer a higher tomato sauce to cheese ratio. But for those who like it super duper cheesy (like myself), it's just a tiny bit disappointing.

The person at the counter was surly and kinda rude. I got the veggie slice and it fell apart into a pile of cheese and soft dough goop. It was bland.

The pepperoni sliced looked much better, but I'm not bothering to go back and try.
Food: 2/5  |  Service: 1/5  |  Atmosphere: 2/5

Prince Street Pizza: A NYC Icon with a Crispy Quest for Perfection

Prince Street Pizza in New York consistently delivers a very good pizza experience, earning a solid 4/5 stars. Their pepperoni slice, with its perfect blend of flavors, is an absolute must-try. However, I've encountered the occasional burnt crust on a few visits, which is the sole blemish on their otherwise impeccable record. As for the long lines, it's a testament to their reputation for serving some of the city's finest slices. Prince Street Pizza is a NYC gem that's just a few tweaks away from pizza perfection. A slice of heaven awaits, but patience may be required.
I love the pizza its great and they have good customer service and good prices check them out if you get the opportunity.

Pizza great! Long line not so great. Can't help it I suppose due to the popularity.

Love the pepperonis & crust. There is a covered table space outside of the restaurant to stand/sit.

Not New York-style pizza, but indulge in the square pie and the grease-filled pepperonis why don't ya. One tip: The line is long but it honestly keeps moving if you have a semblance of patience. Another tip: This is isn't really a sit down place unless you want to eat in the little outdoor area outside. Bonus tip: It's in a really quaint part of New York perfect for strolling and people-watching. It doesn't get 5 stars because pizza should be held to the highest standard.
Really great slice. Typical NY style pizza - cross between neopolitan and Roman style. Great toppings, nice crunch and great flavor. Definitely one of my favorites in New York
Line took a minute but the pizza was great. Definitely thicker than your typical new york slice. My favorites were the vodka slice and pepperoni
Thought the pizza could have been crispier, but pretty good flavor. We had spicy pepperoni and vodka slices. Vodka sauce was good. Be prepared to wait 1+ hour.

Had to try this legendary place. There was a queue down the street. I have to say, it's just ok. The service is transactional at best and the pizza was tasty, the pepperonis were crispy, the sauce was fruity. It was way too greasy for me personally. Glad I tried it, I don't feel the need to return.

Since when is this place cash only? We wait 40 min on line just to be told that it's cash only. I asked why there wasn't a sign on the door and the guy literally just ignores me. This place has gone to crap after Covid. Never again.
